paper_abstract: This paper shows that for any given polynomial ideal J subset of K[x(1), ... , x(n)] the collection of Grobner cones corresponding to 3-specific elimination orders forms a star-shaped region which contrary to first intuition in general is not convex. Moreover we show that the corresponding region may contain Grobner cones intersecting in the boundary of the Grobner fan in the origin only. This implies that Grobner walks aiming for the elimination of variables from a polynomial ideal can be terminated earlier than previously known. We provide a slightly improved stopping criterion for a known Grabner walk algorithm for the elimination of variables. (C) 2013 Published by Elsevier B.V.
paper_title: Ideal-specific elimination orders form a star-shaped region
